CricScore needs only the email address of the team’s administrator to create an account to sign in to the app. CricScore does not require other team members' phone numbers/email addresses to create a team.

There is an option for users to sign in anonymously without an email. Later, an email can be linked to the anonymous account. The anonymous user can still use all the signed-in user's features. However, CricScore does not recommend this option as the user will lose all their team's information, scores, and other data when they delete the app from their phone.

Cricscore’s founder created this app single-handedly in his free time to help cricket lovers everywhere enjoy the game more. Please let us know your feedback and suggestions by emailing support@cricscore.net.

The smartLAB walk app for a simple and clear connection with the step counters walk and move from smartLAB or for step measurement with a mobile phone.
Basically, the app records steps, either from the smartLAB Walk or smartLAB move step counter via Bluetooth or with the smartphone itself.
In the app you can then look at the daily steps and compare them to the daily goal.

An individual daily goal for steps can be entered, alternatively a dynamic goal is available, which calculates a suitable goal again and again from your daily average.
In addition, the app can be connected to Apple Health so that only the measured steps can be passed on. The smartLAB step counters can be used very easily with Apple Health.

Main Features:

- Measures steps from smartLAB pedometer (move / walk) or from smartphone
- Shows steps by day in relation to the daily goal
- Displays past daily, weekly, monthly and yearly increments
- Calculates calorie consumption and distance run with additional data
- Can connect to Apple Health

In any case, only the step count is sent to Apple Health, all other information you enter is only saved locally.
